declarations.name: example
styles
SyncEditorChanges
declarations.description:
A void component that's responsible for keeping the editor
state in sync with incoming changes (aka. external updates) and
triggering onChange events.

This component is a hack to work around the limitation of Plate v17+
where we can no longer access the editor instance outside the Plate
provider.

declarations.name: newResourceEntitySelectorConfigFromRichTextField
declarations.description:
Returns a config for the entity selector based on a given rich text field and a
rich text node type that the entity should be picked for. Takes the field
validations for the given node type into account.

declarations.name: getNextNode
declarations.description:
This traversal strategy is unfortunately necessary because Slate doesn't
expose something like Node.next(editor).

declarations.name: extractParagraphs
declarations.description: It filters out all paragraphs and headings from a path and convert them into paragraphs.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: A valid constructor argument for moment()

parameters.name: short
parameters.description: Render only Today/Tomorrow/Yesterday if valid. Defaults to false

declarations.name: formatTime
declarations.description:
Returns the time portion of a date in the local time in the format H:MM AM/PM

== Examples
* `T15:36:45.000Z` => 3:36 PM (if in +0:00 offset)

declarations.name: getAllowedResourcesForNodeType
declarations.description:
Given a field object and a rich text node type, return a list of allowed
resources associated with the node type, based on that node type's
`allowedResources` property.

The navigation here is explained by the `nodes` validation having signature:
{ nodes: { [nodeType]: { allowedResources: AllowedResource[] } } }

We defensively navigate through this object because
1) the field may not have a `validations` array,
2) the `validations` array may be empty,
3) the `validations` array may not have a `nodes` validation, and
4) the `nodes` validation may not validate the `nodeType`.

declarations.name: getLinkedContentTypeIdsForNodeType
declarations.description:
Given a field object and a rich text node type, return a list of valid
content type IDs associated with the node type, based on that node type's
`linkContentType` validation.

If there is no such validation or the validation is empty, return an empty
array.

The navigation here is explained by the `nodes` validation having signature:
{ nodes: { [nodeType]: validationObject[] } }

We defensively navigate through this object because
1) the field may not have a `validations` array,
2) the `validations` array may be empty,
3) the `validations` array may not have a `nodes` validation,
4) the `nodes` validation may not validate the `nodeType`, and
5) the `nodeType` validations may not have a `linkContentType` validation.

Note that passing an empty array will result in all possible content types
being whitelisted.

declarations.name: watchCurrentSlide
declarations.description:
Allows to observe when the current slide-in navigation slide gets e.g.
re-activated after opening another slide on top. This is useful as the sdk
does not give full insights into e.g. whether sdk.dialogs.selectSingleEntry()
with `withCreate: true` option opens the slide-in navigation to edit the
created entry after returning it.

declarations.name: toSlateValue
declarations.description:
Converts a Contentful rich text document to the corresponding slate editor
value

declarations.name: normalizeInitialValue
declarations.description:
The only reason for this helper to exist is to run the initial normalization
before mounting the Plate editor component which in turn avoids the false
trigger of `onChange`.

Background:

Due to legacy behavior, it's possible to have "valid" RT document (based on
the schema from rich-text-types) that doesn't make sense. For example, links
with no text nodes?[1]. Solving that requires an initial normalization pass
which modifies the slate tree by definition -> triggering onChange.

The initial onChange trigger is undesirable as the user may not have touched
the RT content yet or the editor is rendered as readonly.

Ideally, we should not initialize the editor twice but that's the only
way that I could get this to work. Improvements are welcome.

[1]: See cypress/e2e/rich-text/.../invalidDocumentNormalizable.js for more
     examples.

declarations.name: getText
declarations.description: Get text content at location

declarations.name: normalize
declarations.description: Apply editor normalization rules

declarations.name: setSelection
declarations.description: Set the selection to a location

type.text: Path | BasePoint | BaseRange | Span | null | undefined

declarations.name: setEditorValue
declarations.description:
Plate api doesn't allow to modify (easily) the editor value
programmatically after the editor instance is created.

This function is inspired by:
https://github.com/udecode/plate/issues/1269#issuecomment-1057643622

declarations.name: disableCorePlugins
createCommandPalettePlugin
declarations.description:
A command palette plugin (aka slash commands)

How does it work?
* When the user presses the slash key, the editor will show a command palette
* When the user presses a key, the command palette will show the command suggestions
* When the user presses enter, the command palette will execute the command
* When the user presses escape, the command palette will hide
* When the user presses a letter, number, or space, the command palette will show the command suggestions
* When the user presses backspace, the command palette will remove the last character from the command string

declarations.name: styles
trimLeadingSlash
declarations.description: Trim leading slash character if found. Bails otherwise.

declarations.name: HeadingComponents
declarations.default:
{
  [BLOCKS.HEADING_1]: React.memo(createHeading('h1', BLOCKS.HEADING_1)),
  [BLOCKS.HEADING_2]: React.memo(createHeading('h2', BLOCKS.HEADING_2)),
  [BLOCKS.HEADING_3]: React.memo(createHeading('h3', BLOCKS.HEADING_3)),
  [BLOCKS.HEADING_4]: React.memo(createHeading('h4', BLOCKS.HEADING_4)),
  [BLOCKS.HEADING_5]: React.memo(createHeading('h5', BLOCKS.HEADING_5)),
  [BLOCKS.HEADING_6]: React.memo(createHeading('h6', BLOCKS.HEADING_6)),
}

declarations.name: styles
normalizeOrphanedListItem
declarations.description:
Places orphaned list items in a list. If there's a list somewhere
in the node's ancestors, defaults to that list type, else places
the list item in an unordered list.

declarations.name: insertListItem
declarations.description: Insert list item if selection is in li>p.

declarations.name: baseRules
ensureXSlateFragment
declarations.description:
Get the x-slate-fragment attribute that exist in text/html data
and append it to the DataTransfer object

declarations.name: sanitizeAnchors
declarations.description:
In HTML it's a valid structure to have a block element inside a link e.g:

My link

is fancy

 However, that's not supported in Slate. There are generally two ways to handle this: a) Unwrap inner blocks while preserving the content. e.g. My link is fancy b) Break the link into multiple elements with having each block element as a wrapper for an anchor with the same URL e.g.

My link

and

is fancy

We take approach (a) in here.

declarations.name: sanitizeSheets
declarations.description: Remove empty spreadsheets columns/rows for performance reasons.

declarations.name: shouldResetQuoteOnBackspace
declarations.description:
Returns true if we are:
1) Inside a blockquote
2) With no only one child paragraph/heading and
3) that child is empty

declarations.name: getNoOfMissingTableCellsInRow
declarations.description:
Returns the number of cells in a given row vs the table width

Note: We should only get different table rows cell counts in between
normalization cycles.

declarations.name: transformVoid
declarations.description: Re-creates a void node with valid children.
